intro: Anastrophus obtusifolius, commonly known as the blunt-leafed anastrophus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, which help it store water, and it produces yellow or white flowers during the cooler months. Anastrophus obtusifolius is often found in open vegetation and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
